chapter.title: D-Bus API Reference
chapter.para: This part documents the D-Bus interface used to access the NetworkManager daemon.

chapter.title: Network Configuration Setting Specification
chapter.para: This part documents the properties and value types of each "Setting" object that composes the basic unit of NetworkManager configuration, the "Connection". Each Connection object is simply a dictionary mapping setting names (like "wimax" or "bluetooth") to a dictionary of key/value pairs that represents each itself.

section.title: Secret flag types
section.para: Each secret property in a setting has an associated "flags" property that describes how to handle that secret. The "flags" property is a bitfield that contains zero or more of the following values logically OR-ed together.

itemizedlist.listitem: 0x0 (none) - the system is responsible for providing and storing this secret.
0x1 (agent-owned) - a user-session secret agent is responsible for providing and storing this secret; when it is required, agents will be asked to provide it.

0x2 (not-saved) - this secret should not be saved but should be requested from the user each time it is required. This flag should be used for One-Time-Pad secrets, PIN codes from hardware tokens, or if the user simply does not want to save the secret.

0x4 (not-required) - in some situations it cannot be automatically determined that a secret is required or not. This flag hints that the secret is not required and should not be requested from the user.
